alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Leslie; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Harlan, southeastern Leslie, southwestern Letcher and southeastern Perry Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Putney, or 8 miles northeast of Harlan, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pine Mountain, Big Laurel, Nolansburg, Shields and Highsplint around 220 PM EDT. Arthur, Totz, Big Rock, Louellen, Black Bottom, Lejunior, Closplint, Big Fork and Clover-Darby around 225 PM EDT. Gilley, Leatherwood, Diane, Hiram and Yeaddiss around 230 PM EDT. Delphia, Slemp and Gordon around 235 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cumberland, Benham, Defeated Creek, Daisy, Linefork, Cornettsville, Kingdom Come S.P., Blair, Clutts, Lilley Cornett Woods, Skyline, Banks, Hallie, Red Star, Bluefield, Ulvah, Flint, Kings Creek and Partridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
